page.title: 05Yarley Cross Farm
page.content: Cross Farm was built in 1600 and has been used as a farm until purchased by the present owner who runs it as a Bed and Breakfast establishment.They keep chickens,geese and ducks and use the eggs themselves or sell them privately. The farm is a longhouse built so that the people could live in one half of the house and the animals in the other. Inside the farm there is a large fireplace which was built in 1682 and which has the initials C.T.E. on it. This is the man who made it,Clifford Theodore Eakes. Outside in the courtyard there is an old barn which was once used for storing cider and where you can still see the old barrels. At one time the house was used as a school and there are two peepholes in a wall for teachers to spy on pupils.
